title: Book Review: ‘The Hyacinth Girl,’ by Lyndall Gordon
description: Drawing on newly released letters from the poet to Emily Hale, with whom he maintained a decades-long, mostly epistolary affair, “The Hyacinth Girl,” by Lyndall Gordon, reconsiders his life and work.
dc:creator: Katie Roiphe
category: The Hyacinth Girl: TS Eliot's Hidden Muse (Book)
media:credit: Princeton University Library, via Associated Press
media:description: Emily Hale and T.S. Eliot in Dorset, Vt., in 1946. “My love for you has steadily grown into something finer and finer,” Eliot wrote to her. “And I shall always write primarily for you.”
